results.title: Sheep: handle with care. Parts I-III
results.creator_credit: Bob Scarfe and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: A three part program that shows the different aspects of sheep management. Part 1 deals with Mustering, mouthing, teeth trimming, drenching and foot care. Part 2 deals wth crutching, vaccinating, lamb marking and drafting. Part 3 deals with shearing, branding, dipping and jetting

results.title: Indonesian cuisine
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Education Dept. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: Focusing on a family of Indonesian immigrants and their Indonesian student guest, this program shows how Indonesians in Australia seek to preserve their culture through their cuisine and through cultural events which demonstrate their music, dress and customs.

results.title: Artwork design
results.brief_description: Shows how a rough sketch of a circuit proceeds through definite stages to master art work from which a circuit board can later be made.

results.title: Gently down the stream
results.creator_credit: Ray Costello and Education Department Western Australia
results.brief_description: Shows a Year 10 canoeing expedition on the river from Mt Franklin to the Noralup inlet, Western Australia. Demonstrates that the focus of the Outdoor Education Project is preparation for expeditions; and shows the basic understandings for wilderness and adventure activities.

results.title: Of primary importance: a diary of change for equality
results.creator_credit: Bob Scarfe, Andrea C. Allard, Anne Davies and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: A primary school teacher becomes aware of the sexism which surrounds her school, and with the other teachers and parents attempts to change the school’s policy

results.title: ICRC 1983
results.creator_credit: International Committee of the Red Cross

results.title: Red Tape
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Devised by Glenn and Les Mack for the Supplementary Grants Program and shows a school community breaking down barriers to encourage community involvement in school decision making. The school draws its pupils from a housing commission estate and the principal’s aim is to create a school that responds to the community rather than the conventional process of making the commnity respond to the bureaucratic needs of the school.

results.title: Why Not the Kids?
results.creator_credit: Chelsea Productions and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changes…From the Inside”.
Devised by Glenn and Les Mack for the Supplementary Grants Program of Victoria and shows how children can participate in school organisation. Children at a Victorian Primary School formed a committee and applied for and were granted a Supplementary Grant. The children suggested changes in school facilities, organisation and even curricula. In doing so, some of changes that occured challenged teachers’ perceptions of students and caused them to reappraise their role in the school community.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chelsea Productions and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: Eye of the octopus
results.creator_credit: James Siers, Judy Siers and Sierpinski Films
results.brief_description: Based on the true story of a 13 year old New Zealand boy who lives for a summer with the people of Kiribati, a remote Pacific island and learns their customs. He learns fishing, snorkelling, sailing, and survival techniques. Finally he must capture and kill an octopus in the customary manner.
